pages.text: The ball python ($(o)Python regius$()) is a snake native to the savanna biome.$(br2)Ball pythons, when fully grown, reach 3.56 blocks in length, which is surprisingly still small enough to fit in an empty bucket.

They will naturally hunt and kill nearby chickens and rabbits, and can be bred by feeding a pair of pythons raw rabbit meat.$(br2)Roughly 10% of ball pythons captured in the wild exhibit a unique color or pattern called a morph, which can be passed to their offspring.
